pullRequest.body:
This adds a shortcut instance `CharZero â„¤` in the file `Algebra.Ring.Int` (which contains a few other shortcut instances for `â„¤` already). The hope is that this will result in a speed-up.

Note: This requires adding `import Mathlib.Algebra.CharZero.Defs`.

See [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/simp.20prefers.20CharP.2Ecast_eq_zero.20over.20Nat.2Ecast_zero/near/431803537) on Zulip.

There is a positive effect (-22.5 s) on type class inference, but no significant change overall. Still, I think it makes sense to have it.

---

maintainer merge
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

This change means that any use of those instances comes at the cost of unfolding `inferInstance`. In general, please use `infer_instance` the tactic instead of `inferInstance` the term when defining instances

`infer_instance`  the tactic is defined as `exact inferInstance`. So I do not see how this makes a noticeable difference. In fact, trying both versions for `Zero Nat` shows that the term uses the exact same number of heartbeats (and in other cases, the term seems to be even slightly faster).
I can revert this if you insist, though.
Hmm, very strange. This was not the behaviour in Lean 3. Mind bringing it up on Zulip?
Done [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/inferInstance.20vs.2E.20by.20infer_instance/near/432863769).

According to Mario, which version we use does not really matter, so I'll leave it as it is now.
Is there anything else?
No, that's it
